ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Writing a senior thesis has been really helpful for writing long papers and situating my work within a larger field in preparation for graduate school.
working independently, time management skills, editing and structuring a long form argument
I really learned how to engage with multiple different sources in order to answer a multi-dimensional research question.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Having the senior colloquium in the fall is really helpful for getting the groundwork and some pages written for the senior thesis!
would have been helpful to have more workshops/group editing oppourtunities this semester
I think the ER&M department did a great job of offering resources and guidance to the students pursuing year-long research projects.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend writing a senior thesis, especially for students looking into continuing their involvement in academia! It's a lot of work but really rewarding to learn that much, and to make and do the work to prove a new insight into a field.

extras.title:
ER&M 492 01
        The Senior Essay or Project
